text: The king or queen of Jerusalem was the supreme ruler of the Kingdom of Jerusalem, a Crusader state founded in Jerusalem by the Latin Catholic leaders of the First Crusade, Godfrey 1099–1100 Baldwin I 1100–1118 Baldwin II 1118–1131 Melisende 1131–1153 Fulk 1131–1143 Baldwin III 1143–1163 Amalric I 1163–1174 Baldwin IV 1174–1185 Baldwin V 1183–1186 Sibylla 1186–1190 Guy of Lusignan 1186–1190/1192 Isabella I 1190/1192-1205 Conrad I of Montferrat 1190/1192–1192 Henry I of Champagne 1192–1197 Aimery/Amalric II of Lusignan 1198–1205 Maria 1205–1212 John I 1210–1212 Isabella II 1212–1228 Frederick 1225–1228 Conrad II 1228–1254 Conrad III 1254–1268 Hugh 1268–1284 John II 1284–1285 Henry II 1285–1324 Over the years, many European rulers claimed to be the rightful heirs to the kingdom. Category:Kings and Queens of Jerusalem
title: King of Jerusalem
